list_definition.definition: (the sound of) the regular movement of the heart

list_ex_of_english: Sandaldjian would time his motions to come between his heartbeats, thus maximizing his control of his fingers.
When auscultating the heart, doctors listen for abnormal sounds including heart murmurs, gallops, and other extra sounds coinciding with heartbeats.
A machine for detecting heartbeats was in use in a building for vehicles to be driven through, and that had alerted the officials to his presence.
The x-axis denotes the time between heartbeats in seconds while the y-axis represents the voltage of vagal activity in millivolts.
Temporary silences were observed so that sensitive listening devices capable of detecting human heartbeats could be used to locate survivors.
The analysis of heartbeats by modern methods would involve thousands of calculations and these can be done only by a computer of this sort.
Certain serious side effects include diarrhea, allergic reactions, irregular heartbeats, and low or high blood pressure, while less serious side effects include headaches, insomnia, and impotence.
